title: NTPC Green Energy Commences Operations of 69.04 MW Solar Project in Khavda-I, Gujarat
text:
NTPC Green Energy Commences Operations of 69.04 MW Solar Project in Khavda-I, Gujarat
NTPC Green Energy has successfully commenced commercial operations of its 69.04 MW solar project in Khavda-I, Gujarat, as part of the larger 1255 MW project under CPSU scheme Phase-II Tranche-III. The addition increases NGEL group's total installed capacity to 7,996.30 MW and contributes to NTPC group's overall capacity of 85,610 MW.
*this image is generated using AI for illustrative purposes only.
 NTPC Green Energy has successfully commenced operations of its 69.04 MW solar project in Khavda-I, Gujarat, marking a significant milestone in the company's renewable energy expansion strategy. The commercial operation declaration was made effective from 00:00 hours of December 25, 2025.
Project Details
The solar project represents the eighth part capacity of the larger 1255 MW Khavda-I Solar PV Project under CPSU scheme Phase-II Tranche-III. The facility is operated by NTPC Renewable Energy Limited, a wholly owned subsidiary of NTPC Green Energy Limited.
| Parameter | Details |
|---|---|
| Project Capacity | 69.04 MW |
| Location | Khavda-I, Gujarat |
| Technology | Solar Power |
| Status | Commercial Operation |
| Scheme | CPSU Phase-II Tranche-III |
| Total Project Size | 1255 MW |
Capacity Enhancement Impact
With the addition of this 69.04 MW capacity, the total installed capacity of the NTPC Green Energy Limited (NGEL) Group has increased to 7,996.30 MW from the previous commercial capacity of 7,927.26 MW. The commissioning also contributes to the overall NTPC group capacity, which now stands at 85,610 MW.
| Capacity Metrics | Before Addition | After Addition |
|---|---|---|
| NGEL Group Commercial Capacity | 7,927.26 MW | 7,996.30 MW |
| Total NTPC Group Capacity | - | 85,610 MW |
| Capacity Addition | - | 69.04 MW |
Strategic Significance
The commissioning of this solar project aligns with India's renewable energy targets and demonstrates NTPC Green Energy's commitment to expanding its clean energy portfolio. Gujarat continues to be a key state for solar power development, offering favorable conditions for large-scale renewable energy projects.
The Khavda region has emerged as an important hub for renewable energy development, with its favorable solar irradiation levels and supportive infrastructure making it an attractive location for solar power projects. This project addition strengthens NTPC Green Energy's position in the renewable energy sector and contributes to the company's overall capacity expansion plans.
